poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of War"

Red bricks lay bare,
in the cold, cruel morning.
Zelenskiy's plea echoes -
Martial ropes tighten,
to steady trembling hearts.

Nine regions baptized in strife,
Each dawn births sorrow anew.
A package sails from distant shores,
Aid dressed in the guise of politics. 

Johnson casts a somber shadow,
"Worse than expected" -
His words hang,
A half-eaten fruit of promises,
that "will" sadly, never ripen.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war live: Zelenskiy asks parliament to extend martial law; Russian attacks in nine Ukraine regions in past day 12.51pm GMT Summary US senators on Sunday evening released the details of a highly anticipated $118bn package that pairs federal enforcement policy on the US-Mexico border with wartime aid for Ukraine, Israel and others. However, the speaker of the US House of Representatives, Mike Johnson, said the deal was “worse than expected” and that it “will". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
